  • *About the Institute of Imaging Science**
At Vanderbilt we believe the greatest successes for imaging in the future will come from environments where the complementary natures of different imaging approaches are exploited, where experts in basic sciences and technical aspects of image formation and analysis collaborate closely with biomedical scientists who ask appropriate questions, and where the basic underlying science of imaging is fostered.

VUIIS is a trans-institutional initiative within Vanderbilt University serving physicians, scientists, students and corporate affiliates. VUIIS maintains close collaborations in research and training with many parts of our campus including the schools of medicine, engineering, arts and science, law and Peabody College
  • *JOB SUMMARY:**
Develop and maintain highly specialized research imaging methods, and contribute to imaging technology development. Train graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, and staff. Develop specific protocols to meet needs of investigators.
  • *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Develop and maintain highly specialized imaging methods and support technology based on current literature as well as changing experimental needs of investigators. Develop new options as needed. (Modalities currently include MR, PET, RF Coil Development, micro-CT, etc.)

+ Conduct and/or supervise scientific data collection and analysis. Advise investigators on preferred imaging modalities for specific research projects.

+ Exercise independent judgment to design/develop methods and procedures for innovative research studies.

+ Contribute to research so as to merit serving as author or co-author on publications

+ Troubleshoot and maintain complex scientific imaging instrumentation. Modify existing equipment as needed for research aims.

+ Research options and make recommendations for equipment purchases, service agreements, and supplies in such a manner as to maximize efficiency and cost-savings while best supporting the research needs of diverse groups of investigators

+ Interface with various regulatory groups (within Vanderbilt as well as external) to ensure compliance with laws and guidelines.

+ Communicate clearly, effectively, and collaboratively with investigators about methods, processes, results, etc.
